snippet: In the absence of an effective plan by the European Union, the arrangement was an unusual effort by nations to work together to address the humanitarian crisis.
abstract: Serbia and Croatia, formerly at war with each other, agree to joint train service across their borders to ease travel for onslaught of migrants.

byline.contributor: Joseph Orovic contributed reporting from Zadar, Croatia.

lead_paragraph: In the absence of an effective plan by the European Union, the arrangement was an unusual effort by nations to work together to address the humanitarian crisis.

headline.main: Serbia and Croatia, in Rare Cooperation, Provide Trains for Migrants
headline.print_headline: Serbia and Croatia, in Rare Cooperation, Provide Trains for Migrants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
